data.title: Yummmmm!
data.text:
A wonderful place for a summer respite; 40 flavors of cream.
Your favorite is there; moderately priced; some seating, but mostly just an ice cream shoppe in the center of town.

data.title: Great local ice cream stop
data.text: Went once and definitely will be back.  Tried three different flavors and all were delicious with larger then usual scoops.  Appreciated seeing Gifford's ice cream as one of the brands they carried, love their Caramel Caribou.

data.title: Unusual large scoops of ice cream
data.text: Was there @ 11:00 am on a Wednesday morning, besides the worker, I was the only one there. I had a banana split made with pistachio, cherry cream, rum raisin. I had it topped with hot fudge, pineapple, and strawberry ( although I was hoping for a cherry topping). The worker then crowned this masterpiece with mounds of whipped cream the full length of the dish. This was still not complete until he added a cherry on top of each scoop hidden beneath the clouds of whipped cream. They offer 28 flavors when I was there. This is an establishment that believes in God we trust, all others pay cash. I really don't think I will have dinner tonight

data.title: Great variety
data.text: Until this year, I hadn't been to the Churn in years. However, once I went, I wondered why I hadn't come in so long. My boyfriend and I went one night in October and though it was fairly late, they were still open. There were a lot of flavors to choose from, many of which looked really good. Both of us really enjoyed our choices. The prices were comparable to most ice cream places.

data.title: Wonderful ice cream-large scoops
data.text: Went once to the Churn Ice Cream Shoppe and was hooked.  Seemed to go 2-3 times a week after that.  I tried several different flavors and all were scrumptious.  Will go back again soon.

data.title: Locally owned and operated!
data.text: This is one of the few non-corporate restaurants in Bristol. Right on North Main street, they have great ice cream. The owners are a couple who also run the place. The ice cream is good and reasonably priced. On really hot days the line can get long, but be patient it's worth it, and you are supporting a locally owned business.

data.title: Try the Moose Tracks flavor
data.text: In my opinion, this shop has the best ice cream within a 20-mile radius.  Friendly service, and they are open 7 days a week and always at least until 10 PM.
